name: HBCU Week X NFL Scholarship
description: A $10,000 scholarship for students accepted into an HBCU. Applicants must have at least a 3.0 GPA, demonstrate financial need, and hold U.S. citizenship or permanent resident status.

name: Columbia HBCU Fellowship Program
description: Open to seniors and recent graduates of Historically Black Colleges & Universities (HBCUs).

name: 776 Fellowship
description: The 776 Fellowship Program is a two-year program for young people who want to build a better future.

name: JP Morgan Data for Good Hackathon
Atlanta Falcons + Wells Fargo HBCU Fellowship
LPQue Rivalry Scholarship
description: A $1,350 scholarship for high school seniors in Warren County, North Carolina, planning to attend North Carolina A&T State University or North Carolina Central University.

name: Woodbridge VA State Burner's MC College Scholarship
description: A $1,000 scholarship for high school seniors in Virginia planning to attend an HBCU.

name: Columbia HBCU Fellowship Program
description: A full-tuition scholarship for HBCU seniors or recent graduates pursuing a Master of Science at Columbia University, including housing, stipend, and mentorship opportunities.

name: Virginia Humanities HBCU Scholars Fellowship
description: Fellowships ranging from $5,000 to $45,000 for HBCU alumni, faculty, or doctoral candidates conducting humanities-focused research.

name: ETS Presidential Scholarship for HBCU Students
description: A full-tuition scholarship for full-time juniors and seniors attending HBCUs with a minimum 3.5 GPA and financial need.

name: Coca-Cola UNITED Pay It Forward Internship
description: $2,000 internship opportunity for undergraduate students at participating HBCUs with a minimum GPA of 2.5.

name: UNCF General Scholarship
description: Scholarship for full-time undergraduate and graduate students at UNCF member colleges with a minimum GPA of 2.5.

name: McDonald's Black and Positively Golden Scholarship
description: $15,000 scholarship for full-time students at TMCF-member HBCUs with a minimum GPA of 2.7 and financial need.

name: NC Governor's HBCU Internship Program
description: A paid, full-time summer internship program for rising juniors and seniors from North Carolina's HBCUs with a minimum 2.8 GPA. Connects students with major corporations and businesses in the private sector throughout North Carolina. Benefits include hands-on experience, mentorship, skill development, potential for future employment, and a stipend. Open to all majors.

name: NCDHHS HBCU/MSI Internship Program
description: A summer internship program with the North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services for students from HBCUs and Minority Serving Institutions. Offers in-person, hybrid, and remote positions with experiential and project-based options. Undergraduate interns earn $20/hour while graduate students earn $25/hour. Positions are 40 hours/week, Monday-Friday between 8am-5pm.

name: Splunk HBCU Academic Scholarship
description: A $10,000 scholarship for students pursuing technology-related degrees at accredited HBCUs. Recipients also receive exclusive Splunk mentorship and an opportunity to interview for internships or early career roles. Applicants must be enrolled full-time with a minimum 3.0 GPA and submit a resume plus two essay responses.

name: TMCF | NIKE HBCU Scholarship
description: A scholarship of up to $10,000 for outstanding students attending select HBCUs including Atlanta University Center Consortium, Hampton University, LeMoyne-Owen College, Morgan State University, North Carolina A&T, Tennessee State, Texas Southern, and Tuskegee University. Requires a 3.0+ GPA, demonstrated financial need, and U.S. citizenship or permanent residency.

name: HBCU Day-One-Ready Academy
description: A remote, 10-week paid internship program for HBCU students focused on the college-to-career journey. Participants work in pairs to build skills and grow their network. Benefits include community mentoring, skill-building, networking, career opportunities, and financial compensation.

name: UNCF K-12 Education Fellowship
description: A fellowship program for juniors at qualifying HBCUs providing exposure to education organizations specializing in policy, research, advocacy, teaching, and school operations in cities like Chicago, Boston, New York, Nashville, and Atlanta. Open to students of all majors.

name: ABOUT LOVE Scholarship
description: A scholarship supporting students at five specific HBCUs: Lincoln University, Norfolk State University, Bennett College, University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff, and Central State University. Targets students majoring in creative fields such as media and visual arts with at least a 2.0 GPA. Priority given to students with financial hardship.

name: Thurgood Marshall College Fund Internships
description: Paid 10-12 week summer internships with major companies and government agencies. Interns work in various locations across the United States conducting research and/or contributing to organizational enterprises. Includes participation in career readiness workshops and webinars.

name: CBCF HBCU NREI Scholarship
description: A $10,000 scholarship for HBCU students. Part of the Congressional Black Caucus Foundation's scholarship offerings to support African American students pursuing higher education.
